newsitem.title: USA: Maine Gov would weigh workers compensation reforms.
newsitem.headline: Maine Gov would weigh workers compensation reforms.

text.p: Maine Gov. Angus King said he is willing to consider reforms to help injured workers, but would not support any major changes to the state's workers compensation laws.
King said the current system of representation of injured workers before the workers compensation board could be expanded and improved.
He said the pressure should be put on the board to improve the system. The governor says if that if the board does not, he will consider introducing legislation next January.
